title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
iRecto: in graphit left side: bracket nad "repeat"; in graphite on mount left side above drawing: bracket and "1/24" and "satin" and "rep" with indicators to design; in graphite upper right corner: 5

Verso in graphite lower right corner: II - 34 [upside down]; in graphite left side: 2 motifs in 3 3/8
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of colored rectangles with white centers alternating with graphite rectangles executed in short parallel strokes

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Pink, orange and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-452.
